title: Track Sublime Bookmarks Updates Daily
_seo_title: Track Sublime Bookmarks (dreikanter/sublime-bookmarks) Updates Daily - Track Awesome List
description: Sublime Text essential plugins and resources

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Jan 15, 2024
items.content_text:
### Extensions / General Purpose

*   [ApplySyntax (⭐343)](https://github.com/facelessuser/ApplySyntax) — a plugin that allows to detect and apply the syntax of files that might not otherwise be detected properly. For example, files with the .rb extension are usually Ruby files, but when they are found in a Rails project, they could be RSpec spec files, Cucumber step files, Ruby on Rails files (controllers, models, etc), or just plain Ruby files.
*   [EditorConfig (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/editorconfig-sublime) — .editorconfig support.
*   [File Navigator (⭐56)](https://github.com/csch0/SublimeText-File-Navigator) — keyboard-friendly file navigator and manager.
*   [GitGutter (⭐3.9k)](https://github.com/jisaacks/GitGutter) — a plugin to see git diff in gutter.
*   [GitSavvy](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/GitSavvy) — git and GitHub integration.
*   [LSP](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/LSP) — Language Server Protocol support for Sublime Text 3 that gives you IDE features.
*   [PlainTasks](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/PlainTasks) — an opinionated todo-list.
*   [Sidebar Enhancements (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/titoBouzout/SideBarEnhancements) — provides enhancements to the operations on Sidebar of Files and Folders.
*   [StyleToken (⭐49)](https://github.com/vcharnahrebel/style-token) — allows to highlight certain pieces of text with different colors (similar to Notepad++ "Style token" functionality).
*   [Sublime Alignment (⭐518)](https://github.com/wbond/sublime_alignment) — a simple key-binding for aligning multi-line and multiple selections.
*   [Sublime Worksheet (⭐330)](https://github.com/jcartledge/sublime-worksheet) — an inline REPL for JavaScript, PHP, Ruby and more.
*   [SublimeFileBrowser (⭐396)](https://github.com/aziz/SublimeFileBrowser) - Ditch the sidebar and browse your files in a normal tab with your keyboard, like a pro! Also, [Dired](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dired) lets you modify your directory structure using the powerful text editing feature that ST provides.
*   [SublimeLinter (⭐2k)](https://github.com/SublimeLinter/SublimeLinter3) — a plugin that provides a framework for linting code. Whatever language you code in, SublimeLinter can help you write cleaner, better, more bug-free code. SublimeLinter has been designed to provide maximum flexibility and usability for users and maximum simplicity for linter authors.
*   [SublimeREPL (⭐2.1k)](https://github.com/wuub/SublimeREPL) — runs an interpreter inside ST2 (Clojure, CoffeeScript, F#, Groovy, Haskell, Lua, MozRepl, NodeJS, Python, R, Ruby, Scala, shell or configure one yourself).
*   [Sync Settings (⭐288)](https://github.com/mfuentesg/SyncSettings) - The cross-platform solution to keep Sublime Text configuration synchronized
*   [Synesthesia (⭐17)](https://github.com/dariusf/synesthesia) — a plugin for highlighting text with pretty colours.
*   [Trailing Spaces (⭐896)](https://github.com/SublimeText/TrailingSpaces) — highlight trailing spaces and delete them in a flash.

### Extensions / Ruby Profile

*   [Setting up Sublime Text for Ruby development](http://zhuravel.biz/setting-up-sublime-text-for-ruby-development)
*   [Sublime Text setup (⭐713)](https://github.com/mhartl/rails_tutorial_sublime_text) used in the [Ruby on Rails Tutorial](https://www.railstutorial.org/)
*   [RSpec plugin (⭐124)](https://github.com/SublimeText/RSpec)
*   [Sublime Ruby Debugger (⭐429)](https://github.com/shuky19/sublime_debugger) — a debugger plugin for interactive ruby and RoR debugging on Sublime Text.

### Extensions / Python Profile

*   [Anaconda (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/DamnWidget/anaconda) — autocompletion, code linting, IDE features, autopep8 formating, McCabe complexity checker and Vagrant for Sublime Text 3 using Jedi, PyFlakes, pep8, PyLint, pep257 and McCabe that will never freeze your Sublime Text.
*   [Djaneiro (⭐856)](https://github.com/squ1b3r/Djaneiro) — Django support.
*   [SublimeJEDI (⭐933)](https://github.com/srusskih/SublimeJEDI) — Python autocompletion.

### Extensions / JavaScript Profile

*   [CoffeeScript (⭐290)](https://github.com/Xavura/CoffeeScript-Sublime-Plugin) — syntax highlighting and checking, commands, shortcuts, snippets, compilation and more.
*   [JsFormat (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/jdc0589/JsFormat) — a JavaScript formatting plugin. It uses the command-line/python-module JavaScript formatter from <http://jsbeautifier.org> to format whole js or json files, or the selected portion(s).
*   [TernJS (⭐800)](https://github.com/ternjs/tern_for_sublime) — a JavaScript type inference engine integration.

### Extensions / Client Side Profile

*   [HTMLPrettify (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/victorporof/Sublime-HTMLPrettify)

### Extensions / LaTeX Profile

*   [LaTeXTools (⭐2k)](https://github.com/SublimeText/LaTeXTools) — an open-source plugin that simplifies working with LaTeX files.

### Extensions / Markdown Editing Profile

*   [MarkdownEditing (⭐3.2k)](https://github.com/SublimeText-Markdown/MarkdownEditing) — powerful Markdown package for Sublime Text with better syntax understanding and good color schemes.

### Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [GotoDocumentation (⭐128)](https://github.com/kemayo/sublime-text-2-goto-documentation) — a plugin to jump to documentation for the current word.

### Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [Alfred Workflow (⭐604)](https://github.com/franzheidl/alfred-workflows/tree/master/open-with-sublime-text) to open files and folders in Sublime Text.

### Fun stuff / Themes

*   [Ayu (⭐4.4k)](https://github.com/dempfi/ayu) — A simple theme with bright colors and comes in three versions — dark, mirage and light for all day long comfortable work.
*   [Ciapre (⭐66)](https://github.com/vinhnx/Ciapre.tmTheme/) - An easy-on-the-eyes Sublime Text/TextMate color scheme.
*   [Cobalt2 (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/wesbos/cobalt2) — A full featured Sublime Text blue theme.
*   [Comfort (⭐2)](https://github.com/devanshdalal/Comfort) — A wonderful theme for sublime Text!.
*   [Cyanide (⭐171)](https://github.com/lefoy/cyanide-theme) — A minimal dark theme.
*   [Soda](http://buymeasoda.github.io/soda-theme/) — Dark and light custom UI themes.
*   [Spacegray](http://kkga.github.io/spacegray/) — A set of custom UI themes for Sublime Text 2/3. It's all about hype and minimal. Comes in different flavors with accompanying Base16 color schemes. <http://kkga.github.io/spacegray>

### Fun stuff / Color Schemes

*   <http://tmtheme-editor.herokuapp.com> — online editor for `tmTheme` format, with large gallery of Sublime Text/Textmate color schemes. GitHib project page: [https://github.com/aziz/tmTheme-Editor (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/aziz/tmTheme-Editor)
*   [Solarized](http://ethanschoonover.com/solarized) — balanced dark and light themes.

### Fun stuff / Alternative Icons

*   [By Jon-Paul Lunney](https://dribbble.com/shots/382465-Sublime-Text-2-update-Replacement-Icon)
*   [By Matheus Falcão](https://www.behance.net/gallery/22168387/Sublime-Text-Icon)

### Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

*   [Anonymous Pro](http://www.marksimonson.com/fonts/view/anonymous-pro)
*   [Bitstream Vera Sans Mono](http://www.dafont.com/bitstream-vera-mono.font)
*   [Droid Sans Mono](http://damieng.com/blog/2007/11/14/droid-font-family-courtesy-of-google-ascender)
*   [Hack](http://sourcefoundry.org/hack/)
*   [Monaco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monaco_%28typeface%29)
*   [PT Mono](http://www.paratype.com/public/)
*   [Progamming Fonts](http://blog.codinghorror.com/progamming-fonts/) and [Revisiting Programming Fonts](http://blog.codinghorror.com/revisiting-programming-fonts/) at [CodingHorror](http://blog.codinghorror.com).

Extensions / General Purpose

  • ApplySyntax (⭐343) — a plugin that allows to detect and apply the syntax of files that might not otherwise be detected properly. For example, files with the .rb extension are usually Ruby files, but when they are found in a Rails project, they could be RSpec spec files, Cucumber step files, Ruby on Rails files (controllers, models, etc), or just plain Ruby files.
  • EditorConfig (⭐1.8k) — .editorconfig support.
  • File Navigator (⭐56) — keyboard-friendly file navigator and manager.
  • GitGutter (⭐3.9k) — a plugin to see git diff in gutter.
  • GitSavvy — git and GitHub integration.
  • LSP — Language Server Protocol support for Sublime Text 3 that gives you IDE features.
  • PlainTasks — an opinionated todo-list.
  • Sidebar Enhancements (⭐2.2k) — provides enhancements to the operations on Sidebar of Files and Folders.
  • StyleToken (⭐49) — allows to highlight certain pieces of text with different colors (similar to Notepad++ "Style token" functionality).
  • Sublime Alignment (⭐518) — a simple key-binding for aligning multi-line and multiple selections.
  • Sublime Worksheet (⭐330) — an inline REPL for JavaScript, PHP, Ruby and more.
  • SublimeFileBrowser (⭐396) - Ditch the sidebar and browse your files in a normal tab with your keyboard, like a pro! Also, Dired lets you modify your directory structure using the powerful text editing feature that ST provides.
  • SublimeLinter (⭐2k) — a plugin that provides a framework for linting code. Whatever language you code in, SublimeLinter can help you write cleaner, better, more bug-free code. SublimeLinter has been designed to provide maximum flexibility and usability for users and maximum simplicity for linter authors.
  • SublimeREPL (⭐2.1k) — runs an interpreter inside ST2 (Clojure, CoffeeScript, F#, Groovy, Haskell, Lua, MozRepl, NodeJS, Python, R, Ruby, Scala, shell or configure one yourself).
  • Sync Settings (⭐288) - The cross-platform solution to keep Sublime Text configuration synchronized
  • Synesthesia (⭐17) — a plugin for highlighting text with pretty colours.
  • Trailing Spaces (⭐896) — highlight trailing spaces and delete them in a flash.

Extensions / Ruby Profile

  • Setting up Sublime Text for Ruby development
  • Sublime Text setup (⭐713) used in the Ruby on Rails Tutorial
  • RSpec plugin (⭐124)
  • Sublime Ruby Debugger (⭐429) — a debugger plugin for interactive ruby and RoR debugging on Sublime Text.

Extensions / Python Profile

  • Anaconda (⭐2.2k) — autocompletion, code linting, IDE features, autopep8 formating, McCabe complexity checker and Vagrant for Sublime Text 3 using Jedi, PyFlakes, pep8, PyLint, pep257 and McCabe that will never freeze your Sublime Text.
  • Djaneiro (⭐856) — Django support.
  • SublimeJEDI (⭐933) — Python autocompletion.

Extensions / JavaScript Profile

  • CoffeeScript (⭐290) — syntax highlighting and checking, commands, shortcuts, snippets, compilation and more.
  • JsFormat (⭐1.4k) — a JavaScript formatting plugin. It uses the command-line/python-module JavaScript formatter from http://jsbeautifier.org to format whole js or json files, or the selected portion(s).
  • TernJS (⭐800) — a JavaScript type inference engine integration.

Extensions / Client Side Profile

  • HTMLPrettify (⭐1.9k)

Extensions / LaTeX Profile

  • LaTeXTools (⭐2k) — an open-source plugin that simplifies working with LaTeX files.

Extensions / Markdown Editing Profile

  • MarkdownEditing (⭐3.2k) — powerful Markdown package for Sublime Text with better syntax understanding and good color schemes.

Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

  • GotoDocumentation (⭐128) — a plugin to jump to documentation for the current word.

Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

  • Alfred Workflow (⭐604) to open files and folders in Sublime Text.

Fun stuff / Themes

  • Ayu (⭐4.4k) — A simple theme with bright colors and comes in three versions — dark, mirage and light for all day long comfortable work.
  • Ciapre (⭐66) - An easy-on-the-eyes Sublime Text/TextMate color scheme.
  • Cobalt2 (⭐1.6k) — A full featured Sublime Text blue theme.
  • Comfort (⭐2) — A wonderful theme for sublime Text!.
  • Cyanide (⭐171) — A minimal dark theme.
  • Soda — Dark and light custom UI themes.
  • Spacegray — A set of custom UI themes for Sublime Text 2/3. It's all about hype and minimal. Comes in different flavors with accompanying Base16 color schemes. http://kkga.github.io/spacegray

Fun stuff / Color Schemes

  • http://tmtheme-editor.herokuapp.com — online editor for tmTheme format, with large gallery of Sublime Text/Textmate color schemes. GitHib project page: https://github.com/aziz/tmTheme-Editor (⭐1.7k)
  • Solarized — balanced dark and light themes.

Fun stuff / Alternative Icons

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Apr 30, 2022
items.content_text:
### Things to Start From

*   [Sublime Text home page](https://www.sublimetext.com/)
*   [Unofficial Documentation](https://docs.sublimetext.io/) — is a first link inside the [official documentation TOC](https://www.sublimetext.com/docs/). It's a good starting point for noobs, as well as a detailed reference for proficient users.
*   [Shortcut Cheat Sheet](https://sweetme.at/2013/08/08/sublime-text-keyboard-shortcuts/) for Linux, Mac OSX, and Windows versions of Sublime Text 3.

### Books

*   [Mastering Sublime Text](https://www.packtpub.com/application-development/mastering-sublime-text) by Dan Peleg (PACKT).
*   [Instant Sublime Text Starter](https://www.packtpub.com/product/instant-sublime-text-starter/9781849693929) by Eric Haughee (PACKT).

### News and Tips

*   [Sublime Blog](https://www.sublimetext.com/blog/) — official news.
*   [Sublime Text Tips](https://sublimetexttips.com) — tips and tricks for mastering Sublime Text.

### Community

*   [Official Forum](https://forum.sublimetext.com/) — general discussion, technical support, ideas and feature requests.
*   SuperUser: [version 2](https://superuser.com/questions/tagged/sublime-text-2), [version 3](https://superuser.com/questions/tagged/sublime-text-3), and [version-agnostic](https://superuser.com/questions/tagged/sublime-text) questions.

### Screencasts

*   [Sublime Text 3 From Scratch](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/sublime-text-3-from-scratch) by  Jesse Liberty (Pluralsight).
*   [Perfect Workflow in Sublime Text 2](https://code.tutsplus.com/courses/perfect-workflow-in-sublime-text-2) — 34 video free lessons at Nettuts+.
items.content_html:
Things to Start From

  • Sublime Text home page
  • Unofficial Documentation — is a first link inside the official documentation TOC. It's a good starting point for noobs, as well as a detailed reference for proficient users.
  • Shortcut Cheat Sheet for Linux, Mac OSX, and Windows versions of Sublime Text 3.

Books

  • Mastering Sublime Text by Dan Peleg (PACKT).
  • Instant Sublime Text Starter by Eric Haughee (PACKT).

News and Tips

  • Sublime Blog — official news.
  • Sublime Text Tips — tips and tricks for mastering Sublime Text.

Community

  • Official Forum — general discussion, technical support, ideas and feature requests.
  • SuperUser: version 2, version 3, and version-agnostic questions.

Screencasts

  • Sublime Text 3 From Scratch by Jesse Liberty (Pluralsight).
  • Perfect Workflow in Sublime Text 2 — 34 video free lessons at Nettuts+.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Nov 20, 2019
items.content_text:
### Extensions / LaTeX Profile

*   [LaTeXing (⭐81)](https://github.com/LaTeXing/LaTeXing) — an extension for which makes your life easier and more comfortable while creating your documents.
items.content_html:
Extensions / LaTeX Profile

  • LaTeXing (⭐81) — an extension for which makes your life easier and more comfortable while creating your documents.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Jan 28, 2018
items.content_text:
### Extensions / JavaScript Profile

*   [JavaScript Enhancements (⭐638)](https://github.com/pichillilorenzo/JavaScriptEnhancements) — plugin that offers smart javascript autocomplete, real-time errors and, also, a lot of features about creating, developing and managing javascript projects (such as Cordova, Ionic, React, etc.). It uses [Flow (⭐22k)](https://github.com/facebook/flow) (javascript static type checker from Facebook) under the hood.
items.content_html:
Extensions / JavaScript Profile

  • JavaScript Enhancements (⭐638) — plugin that offers smart javascript autocomplete, real-time errors and, also, a lot of features about creating, developing and managing javascript projects (such as Cordova, Ionic, React, etc.). It uses Flow (⭐22k) (javascript static type checker from Facebook) under the hood.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Dec 05, 2017
items.content_text:
### Extensions / JavaScript Profile

*   [Bump (⭐78)](https://github.com/yavorsky/Bump) — plugin to keep package.json dependencies fresh. Shows latest npm/yarn dependency version in the neat tooltip on package hover.
items.content_html:
Extensions / JavaScript Profile

  • Bump (⭐78) — plugin to keep package.json dependencies fresh. Shows latest npm/yarn dependency version in the neat tooltip on package hover.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Nov 01, 2017
items.content_text:
### Fun stuff / Color Schemes

*   [Themer](https://themer.mjswensen.com) - tool for generating color schemes (and matching themes for your other development tools, including wallpaper) from your favorite colors.
items.content_html:
Fun stuff / Color Schemes

  • Themer - tool for generating color schemes (and matching themes for your other development tools, including wallpaper) from your favorite colors.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Oct 02, 2017
items.content_html:
Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

  • Fira Mono

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Mar 05, 2017
items.content_text:
### Extensions / General Purpose

*   [PackageResourceViewer (⭐297)](https://github.com/skuroda/PackageResourceViewer) — View and Edit Sublime package resources. Helpful for extensions and themes development.

### Fun stuff / Themes

*   [Flatland (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/thinkpixellab/flatland) — A simple theme and accompanying color scheme for Sublime Text 2 & 3. It is mostly derived from Soda, the right place to start for any custom theme development for Sublime.
*   [Material theme (⭐11k)](https://github.com/equinusocio/material-theme) — This theme brings the Material Design visual language. <http://equinsuocha.io/material-theme>
*   [Predawn (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/jamiewilson/predawn) — Dark interface and syntax theme for Sublime Text and Atom. <http://jamiewilson.io/predawn>
*   [Sublime Theme Switcher (⭐16)](https://github.com/chmln/sublime-text-theme-switcher-menu) — Painless theme selection.

### Fun stuff / Color Schemes

*   [colorsublime.com](http://colorsublime.com) - huge collection of color schemes for Sublime Text.
*   [Schemr (⭐135)](https://github.com/benweier/Schemr) — allows you to quickly change your color scheme using the command palette and keyboard shortcuts.
items.content_html:
Extensions / General Purpose

  • PackageResourceViewer (⭐297) — View and Edit Sublime package resources. Helpful for extensions and themes development.

Fun stuff / Themes

  • Flatland (⭐2.7k) — A simple theme and accompanying color scheme for Sublime Text 2 & 3. It is mostly derived from Soda, the right place to start for any custom theme development for Sublime.
  • Material theme (⭐11k) — This theme brings the Material Design visual language. http://equinsuocha.io/material-theme
  • Predawn (⭐1.8k) — Dark interface and syntax theme for Sublime Text and Atom. http://jamiewilson.io/predawn
  • Sublime Theme Switcher (⭐16) — Painless theme selection.

Fun stuff / Color Schemes

  • colorsublime.com - huge collection of color schemes for Sublime Text.
  • Schemr (⭐135) — allows you to quickly change your color scheme using the command palette and keyboard shortcuts.

items.content_text:
### Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [LiveReload (⭐142)](https://github.com/alepez/LiveReload-sublimetext3) — a web browser page reloading plugin.
items.content_html:
Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

  • LiveReload (⭐142) — a web browser page reloading plugin.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Feb 20, 2017
items.content_text:
### Extensions / Ruby Profile

*   [ProductiveSnippetsRuby (⭐108)](https://github.com/janlelis/productive-sublime-snippets-ruby/) — consistent set of alternative snippets, focusing on core and stdlib ([Cheatsheet (⭐108)](https://github.com/janlelis/productive-sublime-snippets-ruby/blob/master/CHEATSHEET.md))
items.content_html:
Extensions / Ruby Profile

  • ProductiveSnippetsRuby (⭐108) — consistent set of alternative snippets, focusing on core and stdlib (Cheatsheet (⭐108))

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Oct 29, 2016
items.content_text:
### Fun stuff / Color Schemes

*   [Dracula (⭐97)](https://github.com/dracula/sublime) - spooky color scheme, perfect for Halloween.  Also available for terminal and [several other applications](https://draculatheme.com/).
items.content_html:
Fun stuff / Color Schemes

  • Dracula (⭐97) - spooky color scheme, perfect for Halloween. Also available for terminal and several other applications.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Nov 14, 2015
items.content_text:
### Things to Start From

*   [Package Control](https://packagecontrol.io/) — the first thing to do after the ST installation is to setup the package manager.

### Community

*   [Sublime Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/SublimeText) — user-generated news links and discussions.

### Screencasts

*   [The Complete Visual Guide to Sublime Text 3](https://scotch.io/bar-talk/the-complete-visual-guide-to-sublime-text-3-getting-started-and-keyboard-shortcuts): Getting Started and Keyboard Shortcuts (free course).
*   [Sublime Text 2](https://pragprog.com/screencasts/v-mrst2/sublime-text-2) by Mike Riley (Pragmatic Studio).

### Extensions / Python Profile

*   [Setting up Sublime Text for Python development](https://dbader.org/blog/setting-up-sublime-text-for-python-development)

### Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [DashDoc (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/farcaller/DashDoc) — [Dash](https://kapeli.com/dash) integration for Sublime Text.

### Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [Associating text editors with Git](https://help.github.com/articles/associating-text-editors-with-git/)

### Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

*   [Adobe Source Code Pro (⭐20k)](https://github.com/adobe-fonts/source-code-pro)
*   [What are the best programming fonts?](http://www.slant.co/topics/67/~programming-fonts)
items.content_html:
Things to Start From

  • Package Control — the first thing to do after the ST installation is to setup the package manager.

Community

  • Sublime Reddit — user-generated news links and discussions.

Screencasts

  • The Complete Visual Guide to Sublime Text 3: Getting Started and Keyboard Shortcuts (free course).
  • Sublime Text 2 by Mike Riley (Pragmatic Studio).

Extensions / Python Profile

  • Setting up Sublime Text for Python development

Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

  • DashDoc (⭐1.3k) — Dash integration for Sublime Text.

Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

  • Associating text editors with Git

Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

  • Adobe Source Code Pro (⭐20k)
  • What are the best programming fonts?

items.content_text:
### Extensions / General Purpose

*   [Origami (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/SublimeText/Origami) — split the window however you like! Create new panes, delete panes, move and clone views from pane to pane.

Extensions / General Purpose

  • Origami (⭐1.2k) — split the window however you like! Create new panes, delete panes, move and clone views from pane to pane.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Aug 05, 2014
items.content_text:
### Extensions / Client Side Profile

*   [Hayaku](http://hayakubundle.com) — fuzzy abbreviations, support for preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus) and a lot of other features in easily configurable set of tools for writing CSS faster.
items.content_html:
Extensions / Client Side Profile

  • Hayaku — fuzzy abbreviations, support for preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus) and a lot of other features in easily configurable set of tools for writing CSS faster.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Jul 21, 2014
items.content_text:
### Extensions / Client Side Profile

*   [GutterColor (⭐486)](https://github.com/ggordan/GutterColor) — displays color sample in the gutter for each line in CSS containing color code.
items.content_html:
Extensions / Client Side Profile

  • GutterColor (⭐486) — displays color sample in the gutter for each line in CSS containing color code.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Jul 20, 2014
items.content_text:
### Extensions / General Purpose

*   [FindKeyConflicts (⭐150)](https://github.com/skuroda/FindKeyConflicts) — identify conflicting key mappings.
*   [Glue (⭐252)](https://github.com/chrissimpkins/glue) — a cross-platform, extensible plug-in for Sublime Text 2 and 3 that connects your favorite editor to your shell.

### Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

*   [Recommended Fonts for Programming?](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4689/recommended-fonts-for-programming) at StackOverflow.
items.content_html:
Extensions / General Purpose

  • FindKeyConflicts (⭐150) — identify conflicting key mappings.
  • Glue (⭐252) — a cross-platform, extensible plug-in for Sublime Text 2 and 3 that connects your favorite editor to your shell.

Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

  • Recommended Fonts for Programming? at StackOverflow.

items.title: Sublime Bookmarks Updates on Jul 19, 2014
items.content_text:
### Things to Start From

*   [ShortcutFoo](https://www.shortcutfoo.com/app/tutorial/sublimetext) — shortcut usage training.

### Extensions / General Purpose

*   [All Autocomplete (⭐919)](https://github.com/alienhard/SublimeAllAutocomplete) — extends the default autocomplete to find matches in all open files.

### Extensions / Ruby Profile

*   [ChangeQuotes (⭐123)](https://github.com/colinta/SublimeChangeQuotes) — converts single to double or double to single quotes.
*   [BeautifyRuby (⭐260)](https://github.com/CraigWilliams/BeautifyRuby) — beautifies Ruby code.

### Extensions / Python Profile

*   [Sublime Text 3 for Python development](http://piotr.banaszkiewicz.org/blog/2013/08/24/sublime-text-3-for-python-development/)
*   [Sublime Text 3 for Python, JavaScript and web developers](http://opensourcehacker.com/2014/03/10/sublime-text-3-for-python-javascript-and-web-developers/)
*   [Rope (⭐2.1k)](https://github.com/python-rope/rope) — a Python refactoring library.
*   [SublimeLinter PEP 257 (⭐10)](https://github.com/SublimeLinter/SublimeLinter-pep257) — an interface to [PEP 257 (⭐1.1k)](https://github.com/GreenSteam/pep257#pep-257-docstring-style-checker) (docstring style checker).
*   [SublimePythonTidy (⭐41)](https://github.com/witsch/SublimePythonTidy) — [PythonTidy](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PythonTidy/) integration.

### Extensions / Client Side Profile

*   [Emmet](http://emmet.io) — a plugin for many popular text editors which greatly improves HTML & CSS workflow.

### Extensions / Markdown Editing Profile

*   [Markdown Preview (⭐2.3k)](https://github.com/revolunet/sublimetext-markdown-preview) — preview and build your markdown files quickly in your web browser from Sublime Text.

### Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [HowDoI (⭐218)](https://github.com/azac/sublime-howdoi-direct-paste) — integration for instant [coding answers search tool (⭐11k)](https://github.com/gleitz/howdoi).

### Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

*   [Command line usage](http://www.sublimetext.com/docs/2/osx_command_line.html) (for OS X).

### Fun stuff / Color Schemes

*   [Base 16 (⭐818)](https://github.com/chriskempson/base16) — carefully chosen syntax highlighting and a default set of sixteen colors.

### Fun stuff / Alternative Icons

*   [By Chris Lee](https://dribbble.com/shots/382409-Sublime-Text-2-Icon)
*   [By Daniel Matarazzo](https://github.com/dbmzzo/Sublime-Text-2-Icon)
*   [By Ernest Ojeh](https://dribbble.com/shots/1027361-Sublime-Text-icon-replacement-for-Flatland-Theme)
*   [By Shi Yan Hui](https://github.com/shiyanhui/Sublime-Text-Icon)
*   [By Tomas Sykora (⭐11)](https://github.com/syky27/Sublime-Text-Icon)

### Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

*   [Consolas](http://www.fonts.com/font/microsoft-corporation/consolas) (goes with Microsoft Office)
*   [Deja Vu Sans Mono](http://dejavu-fonts.org)
*   [Inconsolata](http://levien.com/type/myfonts/inconsolata.html)
items.content_html:
Things to Start From

  • ShortcutFoo — shortcut usage training.

Extensions / General Purpose

  • All Autocomplete (⭐919) — extends the default autocomplete to find matches in all open files.

Extensions / Ruby Profile

  • ChangeQuotes (⭐123) — converts single to double or double to single quotes.
  • BeautifyRuby (⭐260) — beautifies Ruby code.

Extensions / Python Profile

  • Sublime Text 3 for Python development
  • Sublime Text 3 for Python, JavaScript and web developers
  • Rope (⭐2.1k) — a Python refactoring library.
  • SublimeLinter PEP 257 (⭐10) — an interface to PEP 257 (⭐1.1k) (docstring style checker).
  • SublimePythonTidy (⭐41) — PythonTidy integration.

Extensions / Client Side Profile

  • Emmet — a plugin for many popular text editors which greatly improves HTML & CSS workflow.

Extensions / Markdown Editing Profile

  • Markdown Preview (⭐2.3k) — preview and build your markdown files quickly in your web browser from Sublime Text.

Extensions / Documentation and Help Systems

  • HowDoI (⭐218) — integration for instant coding answers search tool (⭐11k).

Integration / Documentation and Help Systems

  • Command line usage (for OS X).

Fun stuff / Color Schemes

  • Base 16 (⭐818) — carefully chosen syntax highlighting and a default set of sixteen colors.

Fun stuff / Alternative Icons

  • By Chris Lee
  • By Daniel Matarazzo
  • By Ernest Ojeh
  • By Shi Yan Hui
  • By Tomas Sykora (⭐11)

Fun stuff / Monospace Fonts

  • Consolas (goes with Microsoft Office)
  • Deja Vu Sans Mono
  • Inconsolata
